source: Urine glucose monitoring is too inaccurate to be recommended .
ref: Urine testing can be misleading because the amount of glucose in the urine may not reflect the current level of glucose in the blood .

source: If the mutation is known , molecular genetic techniques can identify heterozygous phenotypically normal people ( eg , most of the time , people with cystic fibrosis ) .
ref: In addition , because typical genetic testing does not look for all of the more than 1,900 different cystic fibrosis mutations , failure to detect two mutations does not guarantee the person does not have cystic fibrosis ( although the chance of having cystic fibrosis is very low ) .

source: Bronchial carcinoma can lead to obstruction that causes pneumonia and abscess formation .
ref: Usually , people develop only one lung abscess as a result of aspiration or airway obstruction .

source: Hypereosinophilic syndrome , a systemic disease affecting multiple organs , is discussed elsewhere .
ref: People of any age can develop hypereosinophilic syndrome , but it is more common in men older than 50 .

source: Sometimes combinations of findings suggest a cause ( see table Findings Related to Weakness Suggesting a Specific Disorder ) .
ref: People may have other symptoms depending on what is causing the weakness .

source: Chronic fatigue syndrome ( CFS ) is life -altering fatigue lasting > 6 mo that typically affects previously healthy and active people ; it is not malingering .
ref: Chronic fatigue syndrome is a disorder of unknown cause that results in fatigue and certain other symptoms .

source: Paraphimosis should be reduced immediately because the constricting foreskin functions as a tourniquet , causing edema and pain .
ref: In paraphimosis , the retracted foreskin can not be pulled forward to cover the glans penis .

source: Gastric emptying is considered if it can be done within 1 h of a life -threatening ingestion .
ref: Stomach emptying ( inducing vomiting or stomach pumping ) , once commonly done , is now usually avoided because it removes only a small amount of the poison and can cause serious complications .

source: Ehrlichiosis is caused mainly by Ehrlichia chaffeensis ; anaplasmosis is caused by Anaplasma phagocytophilum .
ref: Symptoms of ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis are similar , but anaplasmosis is less likely to cause a rash .

source: Symptoms are rarely intense in such chronic mycoses , but fever , chills , night sweats , anorexia , weight loss , malaise , and depression may occur .
ref: Symptoms include weight loss , night sweats , a mild fever , and a general feeling of illness ( malaise ) .

source: Exercise or pharmacologic stress ( eg , with dobutamine or dipyridamole infusion ) may be used .
ref: In people unable to exercise , an intravenous injection of a drug , such as dipyridamole , dobutamine , or adenosine , may be used to simulate the effects of exercise on blood flow .

source: Diagnosis is by CT , magnetic resonance angiography , or renal venography .

source: Recurrent tumors can be treated with another course of radiation , commonly with brachytherapy ( radioactive implant placement ) ; radionecrosis of the skull base is a risk .
ref: Combined treatment with brachytherapy and external beam radiation therapy is sometimes recommended for more aggressive cancers .

source: Most patients , especially those with lytic lesions and generalized osteoporosis or osteopenia , should receive a monthly IV bisphosphonate ( either pamidronate or zoledronic acid ) .
ref: Bisphosphonates ( used to treat osteoporosis ) , such as pamidronate or zoledronate , reduce bone pain and bone loss and may prevent or delay bone problems that can result when cancer spreads to bone .

source: Other symptoms of venous or arterial thrombosis may also develop .
ref: Sometimes people who have very extensive superficial venous thrombosis are also given heparin or a different anticoagulant to help limit the blood 's clotting .

source: Oral appliances are designed to advance the mandible or , at the very least , prevent retrusion during sleep .
ref: These devices are more uncomfortable than mandibular advancement devices .

source: Local areas of pulmonary edema created by lavage may cause transient hypoxemia .
ref: If acute pulmonary edema ( rapid accumulation of fluid in the lungs ) develops , oxygen is given through a face mask .

source: Intravenous corticosteroids have been reported to delay onset of multiple sclerosis for at least 2 years .
ref: Although corticosteroids may shorten relapses and slow the progression of multiple sclerosis , they do not stop its progression .

source: Compliance can be decreased by repeated infections or by outlet obstruction , with resulting bladder muscle hypertrophy .
ref: Treatment depends on whether the cause is bladder outlet obstruction , weak bladder wall muscles , or both .

source: These drugs reduce risk of seizures during the first week after injury but do not prevent permanent posttraumatic epilepsy months or years later .
ref: During status epilepticus , the seizures may be continuous or the child may have seizures that repeat at brief intervals without the child regaining consciousness in-between seizures .

source: The developing edema and exudate result in partial obstruction , which is most pronounced on expiration and leads to alveolar air trapping .
ref: In emphysema , the destruction of alveolar wall attachments results in collapse of the bronchioles when a person exhales , causing airflow obstruction that is permanent and irreversible .

source: Nearly all are acquired abroad , but a small number result from blood transfusions or rarely from transmission by local mosquitoes that feed on infected immigrants or returning travelers .

source: Burning mouth syndrome is a diagnosis of exclusion once other causes have been ruled out .
ref: Burning mouth syndrome probably represents a number of different conditions with different causes but a common symptom .

source: l-Thyroxine is contraindicated in older patients with nontoxic nodular goiter , because these goiters rarely shrink and may harbor areas of autonomy so that l-thyroxine therapy can result in hyperthyroidism .
ref: Less common causes include growths ( nodules ) on the thyroid gland , inflammation of the thyroid gland ( thyroiditis in which hyperthyroidism is temporary , being followed by hypothyroidism ) , and some drugs .

source: Treat chronic hepatitis C of all genotypes with interferon -free regimens of direct -acting antivirals .
ref: There is no specific treatment for acute hepatitis D , but chronic hepatitis D may be treated with interferon alfa .

source: If the patient is stable and clinical suspicion for ectopic pregnancy is low , serial beta- hCG levels may be done on an outpatient basis .
ref: If the likelihood of an ectopic pregnancy is low , hCG levels are measured periodically .

source: Instructing patients to bring all drug containers to the office can help identify drugs that increase risk .
ref: A pharmacist can provide containers that help people take drugs as instructed .

source: Minor cutaneous abscesses may require only incision and drainage .

source: Food can be contaminated by staphylococcal carriers or people with active skin infections .
ref: The staphylococci bacteria grow in food , in which they produce toxins .

source: The onset may be rapid or gradual with loss of purposeful hand skills and spoken language .
ref: Development of motor and language skills may be delayed .

ref: If more than 2 days go without using the patch , women should use a backup contraceptive method for 7 days in addition to the patch .

source: The increase in urine osmolality is 50 to 100 % in central diabetes insipidus vs 15 to 45 % with partial central diabetes insipidus .
ref: If too little antidiuretic hormone is produced ( a condition called central diabetes insipidus ) or if the kidneys are unable to properly respond to it ( nephrogenic diabetes insipidus ) , the person urinates excessively .

source: Muscles of the hands , feet , and face are not involved except in inclusion body myositis , in which distal involvement , especially of the hands , is characteristic .
ref: The muscles of the hands , feet , and face , however , are not usually affected .

ref: Some types of dementia can also cause aphasia that progressively worsens .

ref: Treatment of herpes simplex keratitis should be started as soon as possible .

source: Typically , an autosomal dominant disorder is expected to be present in one or both parents of an affected person .
ref: This dystrophy is a rare autosomal dominant disorder ( only one affected parent is needed to pass the trait on to offspring ) that affects males and females .

source: The nails typically are deformed and discolored white or yellow .
ref: In more severe infections , the nails thicken and appear deformed and discolored .

source: There is an increased risk of bleeding and arterial or venous thrombosis .
ref: A few increase the risk of clot formation in both arteries and veins .

source: Fetal cells are sometimes detected in patients who do not have the amniotic fluid embolism .
ref: Amniotic fluid embolism occurs when some amniotic fluid ( the fluid that surrounds the fetus in the uterus ) that contains cells or tissue from the fetus enters the woman ’ s bloodstream and causes a serious reaction in the woman .

source: If initial systolic BP is > 160 mm Hg , 2 drugs should be initiated regardless of lifestyle .
ref: For people with blood pressure at or above 140/90 mm Hg , usually two drugs are started at the same time .

source: With real -time ultrasonography , fetal movements and heart motion can be directly observed as early as 5 to 6 weeks .
ref: Ultrasonography produces high -quality images , including live-action images that show the fetus in motion .

source: Standard intensive care units ( ICUs ) in public hospitals are not suitable .
ref: Intensive care units ( ICUs ) can be even more confusing .

source: IL-10 is produced by B cells , macrophages , monocytes , Tc cells , Th2 cells , and regulatory T cells .
ref: Also , natural killer cells produce cytokines that regulate some of the functions of T cells , B cells , and macrophages .

source: Diagnosis of GISTs is usually by endoscopy , with biopsy and endoscopic ultrasonography for staging .
ref: Usually , endoscopy ( a visual examination of the digestive tract using a flexible tube called an endoscope ) is done to confirm the diagnosis of a bezoar and to exclude a tumor as the cause .

source: If liver function test results ( eg , unexplained elevations in aminotransferase levels ) are compatible with chronic hepatitis , do serologic tests for hepatitis B and C .
ref: Testing for chronic hepatitis B usually begins with blood tests to determine how well the liver is functioning and whether it is damaged ( liver function tests ) .

source: The most common tumor of the mandible and maxilla is squamous cell carcinoma invading the bone through dental sockets .
ref: Squamous cell carcinoma , which means the cancer develops in the squamous cells that line the inside of the mouth or throat , is by far the most common type of oral cancer .
